spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Shadow Arts
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the drow can cast spells that are invisible, as well as those that aren't invisibility.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage when wielded with two hands.

action.name: Staff
entries: Melee Weapon Attack +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 2 (1d4 - 1) bludgeoning damage when wielded with two hands.

trait.name: Sneight
entries: The orc scout has advantage on ranged attacks against any creature that hasn't yet seen it and to which it has sworn oath-fiance. If it makes a ranged attack against a target that is surprised, the target is instead automatically surprised and has disadvantage on its next attack roll until the end of its next turn.
Furthermore, the scout can't use the Sight and Tell unless on an Orc target encounter.

trait.name: Indomitable (3/Day)
entries: The orc scout can reroll a saving throw it fails. If it uses this option to reroll a saving throw that it fails, it must use the new roll, and must use the new roll if the saving throw was ineffective.

trait.name: Survivor
entries: The orc scout has advantage on saving throws against abilities that were weakened by its previous target until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Unearthly Resilience (3/Day)
entries: The orc scout and its mount gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened while in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc scout makes two attacks, either with its longsword or longbow. If the scout is targeting a creature, it can use its surprise or dexterity modifier to determine which attack targets that creature. If the scout and its mount are within 5 feet of one other when the scout deals damage to it, the scout uses surprise only if at least one of its two attacks is damage automatic.

action.name: Longsword
entries: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

action.name: Quenched Leap
entries: The orc scout jumps out of a sleeping humanoid's body and up to 40 feet. Before or after succeeding on a longsword attack, it can use its reaction to also make a ranged weapon attack against that creature. Once it makes this multiattack, it can't use itereithlongitude for the rest of its turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile target that it can see.

action.name: silence
entries: The orc makes one melee attack against a target within 30 feet of it. The target must make a 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is paralyzed for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half the damage dealt by the orc.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: Melee Weapon Attack +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage or 13 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage if wielded two or more at once.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The orc is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is charisma (Spell save 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries: Mormesk magically touches one creature he can see within 5 feet of him. The target must succeed on a 21 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and be charmed by Mormesk for 1 minute. The charmed target is paralyzed, and instead of holding its breath underwater, it tries to breathe normally and immediately runs out of gas, ending its challenge and becoming unconscious. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
